analyzed: gṛhasthasya paraḥ dharmaḥ devatā abhyarcanam tathā

analyzed: vaivāhmam agnim indhīta sāyam prātar yathāvidhi
translated: One should kindle the sacrificial fire according to the rules, in the evening and in the morning,

analyzed: trayāṇām āśramāṇām tu gṛhasthaḥ yoniḥ ucyate

analyzed: tasmāt gārhasthyam eva ekam vijñeyam dharma sādhanam

analyzed: parityajet artha kāmau yau syātām dharma varjitau

analyzed: sarva loka viruddham ca dharmam api ācaret na tu

analyzed: dharmāt saṃjāyate hi arthaḥ dharmāt kāmaḥ bhijāyate

analyzed: dharmaḥ ca arthaḥ ca kāmaḥ ca trivargaḥ triguṇaḥ mataḥ

analyzed: sattvam rajaḥ tamaḥ ca iti tasmāt dharmam samāśrayet

analyzed: yasmin dharma samāyuktau artha kāmau vyavasthitau
translated: In whom Dharma, Artha and Kama are united,

analyzed: dharmāt saṃjāyate mokṣaḥ hi arthāt kāmaḥ bhijāyate

analyzed: evam sādhana sādhya tvam cāturvidhye pradarśitam

analyzed: yaḥ evam veda dharma artha kāma mokṣasya mānavaḥ

analyzed: māhātmyam ca anutiṣṭheta sa ca ānantyāya kalpate

analyzed: anādinidhanā śaktiḥ sā eṣā brāhmī dvijottamāḥ

analyzed: nivṛttam sevamānaḥ tu yāti tat paramam padam
translated: By serving the disengaged, one attains that supreme state.

analyzed: ādi tvāt ādidevaḥ sau a jāta tvāt ajaḥ smṛtaḥ

analyzed: pāti yasmāt prajāḥ sarvāḥ prajāpatiḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: Because He sustains all creatures, He is remembered as Prajapati.

original: deveṣu ca mahādevo māhadeva iti smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: deveṣu ca mahādevaḥ māhadevaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: And among the gods, He is remembered as Mahesvara, the great god.

analyzed: bṛhat tvāt ca smṛtaḥ brahmā para tvāt parameśvaraḥ
translated: And because He is great, He is remembered as Brahma, and because He is supreme, He is the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: vaśi tvāt api avaśya tvāt īśvaraḥ paribhāṣitaḥ
translated: And because He is in control, and because He is not to be controlled, He is defined as the Lord.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ sarvatraga tvena hariḥ sarva haraḥ yatas
translated: The sage is remembered as Hari because he pervades everywhere and because he is the destroyer of all.

analyzed: anutpādāt ca pūrva tvāt svayaṃbhūḥ iti sa smṛtaḥ
translated: He is remembered as Svayambhu (self-existent) because of non-origination, priority, and self-existence.

analyzed: narāṇām ayanaḥ yasmāt tena nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He is remembered as Narayana because he is the abode of men.

analyzed: haraḥ saṃsāra haraṇāt vibhu tvāt viṣṇuḥ ucyate
translated: He is called Vishnu because he is the destroyer of worldly existence and because of his omnipresence.

analyzed: bhagavān sarva vijñāna avanāda ūm iti smṛtaḥ
translated: The Lord is remembered as Om because of his omniscience and because of his being the cause of all.

analyzed: sarvajñaḥ sarva vijñānāt sarvaḥ sarva mayaḥ yatas
translated: He is called Sarva (all) because of his omniscience and because he is the essence of all.

original: śivaḥ sa nirmalo yasmād vibhuḥ sarvagato yataḥ /
analyzed: śivaḥ sa nirmalaḥ yasmāt vibhuḥ sarva gataḥ yatas
translated: He is called Shiva (auspicious) because he is free from impurities and because he is all-pervading.

analyzed: tāraṇāt sarva duḥ khānām tārakaḥ parigīyate
translated: He is sung as Taraka (saviour) because he delivers from all miseries.

analyzed: bahunā atra kim uktena sarvam brahma mayam jagat
translated: What is the use of speaking much here? The entire universe is full of Brahman.

analyzed: aneka bheda bhinnaḥ tu krīḍate parameśvaraḥ
translated: The Supreme Lord plays in the form of many different kinds.

original: ityeṣa prākṛtaḥ sargaḥ saṃkṣepāt kathito mayā /
analyzed: iti eṣa prākṛtaḥ sargaḥ saṃkṣepāt kathitaḥ mayā
translated: Thus, this natural creation has been briefly described by me.

analyzed: a buddhi pūrvakaḥ viprāḥ brāhmīm sṛṣṭim nibodhata
translated: O Brahmins, understand the creation of Brahma, which is not preceded by consciousness.

original: iti śrīkūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pūrvaṃvibhāge caturtho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī kūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryām saṃhitāyām pūrvam vibhāge caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the first section of the Purana of the Tortoise, in the six thousand verses composed by the great sage Krishna Dvaipayana.

analyzed: śrī kūrmaḥ uvāca
translated: The Tortoise said:

analyzed: svayaṃbhuvaḥ vivṛttasya kāla saṃkhyāḥ dvijottamāḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, now I shall tell you the calculation of time of the self-existent one.

analyzed: na śakyate samākhyātum bahu varṣaiḥ api svayam
translated: O best of Brahmins, even if one were to speak for many years, one cannot fully describe the duration of a single day of the self-existent one.

analyzed: kāla saṃkhyā samāsena parārdha dvaya kalpitā
translated: The duration of time is briefly calculated in terms of two parardhas.

original: sa eva syāt paraḥ kālaḥ tadante pratisṛjyate // / / //
analyzed: saḥ eva syāt paraḥ kālaḥ tad ante pratisṛjyate
translated: That itself is the supreme time, at the end of which creation is again commenced.

analyzed: nijena tasya mānena āyuḥ varṣa śatam smṛtam
translated: His own measure of life is said to be one hundred years.

analyzed: tat parākhyam tad ardham ca parārdham abhidīyate
translated: That is called a parardha, and half of that is called a parva.

analyzed: kāṣṭhā pañcadaśa khyātāḥ nimeṣāḥ dvijasattamāḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, fifteen nimeshas (twinklings of an eye) are known as one kashtha.

original: kāṣṭhāstriṃśat kalā triṃśat kalā mauhūrtikī gatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāṣṭhāḥ triṃśat kalā triṃśat kalāḥ mauhūrtikī gatiḥ
translated: Thirty kashthas are one kala, and thirty kalas are one muhurta.

original: tāvatsaṃkhyairahorātraṃ muhūrtairmānuṣaṃ smṛtam /🔽ahorātrāṇi tāvanti māsaḥ pakṣadvayātmakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāvat saṃkhyaiḥ ahorātram muhūrtaiḥ mānuṣam smṛtam  ahorātrāṇi tāvanti māsaḥ pakṣa dvaya ātmakaḥ
translated: It is said that a human day and night consist of as many muhurtas.🔽As many days and nights make a month consisting of two fortnights.

original: taiḥ ṣaḍbhirayanaṃ varṣaṃ dve 'yane dakṣiṇottare /🔽ayanaṃ dakṣiṇaṃ rātrirdevānāmuttaraṃ dinam // / / //🔽divyairvarṣasahastraistu kṛtatretādisaṃjñitam /
analyzed: taiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ ayanam varṣam dve yane dakṣiṇa uttare  ayanam dakṣiṇam rātriḥ devānām uttaram dinam  divyaiḥ varṣa sahastraiḥ tu kṛta tretā ādi saṃjñitam
translated: Six of those make an ayana, and a year consists of two ayanas, the southern and the northern.🔽The southern ayana is the night of the gods, and the northern day.

analyzed: caturyugam dvādaśabhiḥ tad vibhāgam nibodhata
translated: The period consisting of four yugas such as Krita, Treta, etc., is known as a day of Brahma, which lasts for one thousand divine years.🔽Twelve of those make one chaturyuga. Understand its division.

analyzed: catvāri āhuḥ sahastrāṇi varṣāṇām tat kṛtam yugam
translated: The Krita age is said to last for four thousand years.

original: tasya tāvacchatī sandhyā sandhyāṃśaśca kṛtasya tu // / / //
analyzed: tasya tāvacchatī sandhyā sandhyā aṃśaḥ ca kṛtasya tu
translated: Its twilight extends for as many hundred years, and the Krita age has a twilight.

original: triśatī dviśatī sandhyā tathā caikaśatī kramāt /
analyzed: triśatī dviśatī sandhyā tathā ca ekaśatī kramāt
translated: The twilight of the Treta age extends for three hundred years, that of the Dvapara for two hundred years, and that of the Kali for one hundred years.

analyzed: aṃśakam ṣaṭśatam tasmāt kṛ sandhyāṃśakam vinā
translated: The twilight of the Krita age extends for six hundred years, and the twilight of the Krita age is without a twilight.

analyzed: tri dvi eka sāhastram atas vinā sandhyāṃśakena tu
translated: The twilight of the Treta age extends for three thousand years, that of the Dvapara for two thousand years, and that of the Kali for one thousand years.

analyzed: tretā dvāpara tiṣyāṇām kāla jñāne prakīrtitam
translated: The time of the Treta, Dvapara, and Kali ages is declared to be without a twilight.

analyzed: etat dvādaśa sāhastram sādhikam parikalpitam
translated: This is calculated to be twelve thousand years, with an excess.

analyzed: tad ekasaptati guṇam manoḥ antaram ucyate
translated: That is said to be the period of Manu, multiplied by seventy-one.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ divase viprāḥ manavaḥ syuḥ caturdaśa
translated: O Brahmins, in the day of Brahma, there are fourteen Manus,

analyzed: svāyaṃbhuva ādayaḥ sarve tatas sāvarṇika ādayaḥ
translated: all beginning with Svayambhu, and then Savarni and others.

analyzed: taiḥ iyam pṛthivī sarvā saptadvīpā sa parvatā
translated: By them, this entire earth with its seven islands and mountains,

original: pūrṇaṃ yugasahastraṃ vai paripālyā nareśvaraiḥ // / / //🔽manvantareṇa caikena sarvāṇyevāntarāṇi vai /
analyzed: pūrṇam yuga sahastram vai paripālyāḥ nareśvaraiḥ  manvantareṇa ca ekena sarvāṇi eva antarāṇi vai
translated: is to be ruled by the lords of men for a full thousand yugas.

original: vyākhyātāni na saṃdehaḥ kalpaṃ kalpena caiva hi // / / //
analyzed: vyākhyātāni na saṃdehaḥ kalpam kalpena ca eva hi
translated: By a single Manu period, all the intermediate periods are undoubtedly explained, and by a Kalpa, the Kalpa is explained.

analyzed: brāhmam ekam ahar kalpaḥ tāvatī rātriḥ iṣyate
translated: One day of Brahmā is considered to be a Kalpa, and his night is of the same duration.

analyzed: catur yuga sahastram tu kalpam āhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise ones say that a thousand sets of four Yugas make one Kalpa.

analyzed: trīṇi kalpa śatāni syuḥ tathā ṣaṣṭiḥ dvijottamāḥ
translated: Three hundred Kalpas make one day of the gods, O best of Brahmins, and so do sixty.

original: brahmaṇaḥ kathitaṃ varṣaṃ parākhyaṃ tacchataṃ viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ kathitam varṣam para ākhyam tat śatam viduḥ
translated: That is said to be one year of Brahmā, and they know it to be a hundred of those.

analyzed: tasya ante sarva tattvānām sva hetau prakṛtau layaḥ
translated: At the end of that, all the principles dissolve into their original cause.

analyzed: tena ayam procyate sadbhiḥ prākṛtaḥ pratisaṃcaraḥ
translated: Therefore, this is called the natural dissolution by the good people.

analyzed: brahma nārāyaṇa īśānām trayāṇām prakṛtau layaḥ
translated: The three - Brahmā, Nārāyaṇa, and Īśāna - dissolve into Prakṛti.

analyzed: procyate kāla yogena punar eva ca saṃbhavaḥ
translated: It is said that due to the union with time, they arise again.

original: evaṃ brahmā ca bhūtāni vāsudevo 'pi śaṅkaraḥ /
analyzed: evam brahmā ca bhūtāni śaṅkaraḥ
translated: Thus, Brahmā, the beings, Vāsudeva, and Śaṅkara,

original: kālenaiva tu sṛjyante sa eva grasate punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kālena eva tu sṛjyante saḥ eva grasate punar
translated: are created by time itself, and he alone devours them again.

analyzed: anādiḥ eṣa bhagavān kālaḥ nantaḥ jaraḥ maraḥ
translated: This eternal Lord, Time, is infinite, deathless, and immortal.

analyzed: sarvaga tvāt svatantra tvāt sarvātmā asau maheśvaraḥ
translated: Due to being all-pervading and independent, he is the great Lord, the soul of all.

analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ bahavaḥ rudrāḥ hi anye nārāyaṇa ādayaḥ
translated: There are many Brahmās, Rudras, and others like Nārāyaṇa.

original: eko hi bhagavānīśaḥ kālaḥ kaviriti śruti // / / //
analyzed: ekaḥ hi bhagavān īśaḥ kālaḥ kaviḥ iti śruti
translated: But the one Lord is Īśa, Time, the wise one, as the Vedas declare.

original: ekamatra vyatītaṃ tu parārdhaṃ brahmaṇo dvijāḥ /
analyzed: ekam atra vyatītam tu parārdham brahmaṇaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, one Parardha of Brahma has passed.

analyzed: sāṃpratam vartate tadvat tasya kalpaḥ yam aṣṭamaḥ
translated: Now, the present is the eighth Kalpa of him.

original: yo 'tītaḥ saptamaḥ kalpaḥ pādma ityucyate budhaiḥ /
analyzed: saptamaḥ kalpaḥ pādmaḥ iti ucyate budhaiḥ
translated: The past seventh Kalpa is called Padma by the wise.

original: vārāho vartate kalpaḥ tasya vakṣyāmi vistaram // / / //
analyzed: vārāhaḥ vartate kalpaḥ tasya vakṣyāmi vistaram
translated: The Varāha Kalpa is going on. I shall describe it in detail.

original: iti śrīkūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pūrvavibhāge pañcamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī kūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryām saṃhitāyām pūrva vibhāge pañcamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Fifth Chapter in the First Part in the Vamana Purana--5

analyzed: śrī kūrmaḥ uvāca
translated: The Holy Kurma said:

analyzed: āsīt ekārṇavam ghoram avibhāgam tamaḥ mayam
translated: There was a terrible ocean of water, undivided and full of darkness.

original: śāntavātādikaṃ sarvaṃ na prajñāyata kiñcana // / / //🔽ekārṇave tadā tasmin naṣṭe sthāvarajaṅgame /
analyzed: śānta vāta ādikam sarvam na prajñāyata kiñcana  ekārṇave tadā tasmin naṣṭe sthāvara jaṅgame
translated: With all the wind etc. calmed down, nothing could be known at all.🔽When that ocean of water came into being, with all the moving and unmoving things destroyed,

analyzed: tadā samabhavat brahmā sahastrākṣaḥ sahastrapād
translated: then Brahma appeared, with a thousand eyes and a thousand feet.

analyzed: sahastra śīrṣā puruṣaḥ rukma varṇaḥ tu atīndriyaḥ
translated: The thousand-headed Purusha, of golden complexion, beyond the senses,

analyzed: brahmā nārāyaṇa ākhyaḥ tu suṣvāpa salile tadā
translated: Brahma, known as Narayana, then slept in the water.

analyzed: imam ca udāharanti atra ślokam nārāyaṇam prati
translated: Regarding Narayana, they recite this verse:

analyzed: brahma svarūpiṇam devam jagataḥ prabhava apyayam
translated: The god in the form of Brahman, the origin and end of the world.

original: āpo nārā iti proktā nāmnā pūrvamiti śrutiḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ nārāḥ iti proktāḥ nāmnā pūrvam iti śrutiḥ
translated: The waters are called Nara. This is the ancient declaration of the Vedas.

original: ayanaṃ tasya tā yasmāt tena nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ayanam tasya tāḥ yasmāt tena nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Since they are his abode, he is known as Narayana.

analyzed: tulyam yuga sahastrasya naiśam kālam upāsya saḥ
translated: Having passed a night equal to a thousand yugas,

analyzed: śarvarī ante prakurute brahma tvam sarga kāraṇāt
translated: at the end of the night, he creates the position of Brahma for the purpose of creation.

analyzed: tatas tu salile tasmin vijñāya antargatām mahīm
translated: Then, in that water, knowing that the earth was submerged,

analyzed: anumānāt tad uddhāram kartu kāmaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: Prajapati, desiring to lift it up by inference,

analyzed: jala krīḍāsu ruciram vārāham rupam āsthitaḥ
translated: took on the beautiful form of a boar in the water sports,

original: adhṛṣyaṃ manasāpyanyairvāṅmayaṃ brahmasaṃjñitam // / / //🔽pṛthivyuddharaṇārthāya praviśya ca rasātalam /
analyzed: adhṛṣyam manasā api anyaiḥ vāc mayam brahma saṃjñitam  pṛthivī uddharaṇa arthāya praviśya ca rasātalam
translated: incapable of being approached by others even in thought, embodied in speech, known as Brahma.🔽For the sake of lifting up the earth, he entered the nether regions,

analyzed: daṃṣṭrayā abhyujjahāra enām ātma ādhāraḥ dharādharaḥ
translated: and the supporter of the earth, the support of the self, lifted it up with his tusk.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā daṃṣṭra agra vinyastām pṛthivīm prathita pauruṣam
translated: Seeing the earth placed on the tip of his tusk, of renowned manliness,

analyzed: astuvan jana loka sthāḥ siddhāḥ brahmarṣayaḥ harim
translated: the Siddhas and Brahmarishis residing in Janaloka praised Hari.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Rishis said:

analyzed: namaḥ te devadevāya brahmaṇe parameṣṭhine
translated: Salutations to you, the god of gods, to Brahma, the supreme lord,

analyzed: puruṣāya purāṇāya śāśvatāya jayāya ca
translated: to the ancient being, the eternal one, and to the victorious one.

analyzed: namaḥ svayaṃbhuve tubhyam straṣṭre sarva artha vedine
translated: Salutations to you, the Self-Existent One, the Creator, the knower of all objects.

analyzed: namaḥ hiraṇyagarbhāya vedhase paramātmane
translated: Salutations to Hiranyagarbha, the Creator, the Supreme Self.

analyzed: namaḥ te vāsudevāya viṣṇave viśvayonaye
translated: Salutations to you, Vasudeva, Vishnu, the source of the universe.

analyzed: nārāyaṇāya devāya devānām hita kāriṇe
translated: Salutations to Narayana, the god, the benefactor of the gods.

analyzed: namaḥ stu te caturvaktre śārṅga cakra asi dhāriṇe
translated: Salutations to you, the four-faced one, holding the Sharnga bow, discus, and sword.

analyzed: sarva bhūta ātma bhūtāya kūṭasthāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the soul of all beings, to the one abiding in the ultimate.

analyzed: namaḥ veda rahasyāya namaḥ te vedayonaye
translated: Salutations to the secret of the Vedas, salutations to you, the source of the Vedas.

analyzed: namaḥ buddhāya śuddhāya namaḥ te jñāna rūpiṇe
translated: Salutations to the pure Buddha, salutations to you, the embodiment of knowledge.

analyzed: namaḥ stu ānanda rūpāya sākṣiṇe jagatām namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the form of bliss, the witness of the worlds.

analyzed: anantāya aprameyāya kāryāya karaṇāya ca
translated: Salutations to the infinite, the immeasurable, to the effect and the cause.

original: namaste pañcabūtāya pañcabhūtātmane namaḥ /🔽namo mūlaprakṛtaye māyārūpāya te namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: namaḥ te pañcabūtāya pañcabhūta ātmane namaḥ  namaḥ mūlaprakṛtaye māyā rūpāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the five elements, salutations to the soul of the five elements.🔽Salutations to the primordial nature, salutations to you, in the form of Maya.

analyzed: namaḥ stu te varāhāya namaḥ te matsya rūpiṇe
translated: Salutations to you, the boar, salutations to you in the form of a fish.

analyzed: namaḥ yoga adhigamyāya namaḥ sakarṣaṇāya te
translated: Salutations to the one attained through yoga, salutations to you, the creator.

analyzed: namaḥ trimūrtaye tubhyam tri dhāmne divya tejase
translated: Salutations to you, the three-formed one, the three-natured one, of divine radiance.

analyzed: namaḥ siddhāya pūjyāya guṇatraya vibhāvine
translated: Salutations to the accomplished one, the worshipable one, the one who manifests the three qualities.

analyzed: tamaḥ stu āditya varṇāya namaḥ te padmayonaye
translated: Let there be darkness to the one with the color of the sun, salutations to you, the lotus-born one.

original: namo 'mūrtāya mūrtāya mādhavāya namo namaḥ // / / //🔽tvayaiva sṛṣṭamakhilaṃ tvayyeva layameṣyati /
analyzed: namaḥ mūrtāya mūrtāya mādhavāya namaḥ namaḥ  tvayā eva sṛṣṭam akhilam tvayi eva layam eṣyati
translated: Salutations to the formless one, the embodied one, to Madhava, again and again.🔽By you alone is everything created, and it will merge back into you.

original: pālayaitajjagat sarvaṃ trātā tvaṃ śaraṇaṃ gati // / / //
analyzed: pālaya etat jagat sarvam trātā tvam śaraṇam
translated: Protect this entire world, you are the protector, the refuge, the goal.

analyzed: ittham sa bhagavān viṣṇuḥ sanaka ādyaiḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ
translated: Thus was that Lord Vishnu praised by Sanaka and others.

analyzed: prasādam akarot teṣām varāha vapuḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: The Lord of the Boar form, the Lord, showed them grace.

analyzed: tatas saṃsthānam ānīya pṛthivīm pṛthivīpatiḥ
translated: Then the Lord of the Earth, having restored the Earth,

analyzed: mumoca rūpam manasā dhārayitvā prijāpatiḥ
translated: released the form, retaining it in his mind, the Lord of Creation.

analyzed: tasya upari jala oghasya mahatī nauḥ iva sthitā
translated: It remained above the flood of water like a great ship.

original: vitatatvācca dehasya na mahī yāti saṃplavam // / / //🔽pṛthivīṃ tu samīkṛtya pṛthivyāṃ so 'cinod girīn /
analyzed: vitata tvāt ca dehasya na mahī yāti saṃplavam  pṛthivīm tu samīkṛtya pṛthivyām saḥ cinot girīn
translated: And because of the vastness of the body, the Earth did not get submerged.🔽Having leveled the Earth, he arranged the mountains on the Earth.

analyzed: prāk sarga dagdhān akhilān tatas sarge dadhan manaḥ
translated: Then in the next creation, he created all the mountains that were burnt in the previous creation.

original: iti śrīkūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭasāhastryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pūrvavibhāge ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī kūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭasāhastryām saṃhitāyām pūrva vibhāge ṣaṣṭhaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the Purva Khanda of the Skanda Maha Purana, the divine incarnation of Lord Vishnu, narrated by the great sage Narada to the great sage Parvata, in which the creation of the universe is described in detail.

analyzed: śrī kūrmaḥ uvāca
translated: The illustrious tortoise said:

analyzed: sṛṣṭim cintayataḥ tasya kalpa ādiṣu yathā purā
translated: As he thought of creation in the beginning of the kalpa as before,

analyzed: a buddhi pūrvakaḥ sargaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ tamaḥ mayaḥ
translated: The creation that appeared was not preceded by intelligence, and was full of tamas.

analyzed: tamaḥ mohaḥ mahāmohaḥ tāmistraḥ ca andha saṃjñitaḥ
translated: Tamas, moha, mahat-moha, tamisra, and andhatamisra -

analyzed: avidyā pañca parvā eṣā prādurbhūtā mahātmanaḥ
translated: This ignorance with five parts appeared in the great one.

analyzed: pañcadhā avasthitaḥ sargaḥ dhyāyataḥ saḥ abhimāninaḥ
translated: The creation remained in five states, of the one who was meditating and had a sense of ego.

analyzed: saṃvṛtaḥ tamasā ca eva bīja kambhu vana āvṛtaḥ
translated: Covered by tamas, enveloped by the seed-like creation,

original: varhirantaścāprakāśaḥ stabdho niḥ saṃjña eva ca /
analyzed: varhiḥ antar ca aprakāśaḥ stabdhaḥ niḥ saṃjñaḥ eva ca
translated: With hair, inside, not shining, stiff, and without consciousness,

original: mukyā nagā iti proktā mukhyasargastu sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mukyāḥ nagāḥ iti proktāḥ mukhya sargaḥ tu sa smṛtaḥ
translated: They are called mukyas and nagas. This creation is known as mukha-sargam.

analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā asādhakam sargam amanyat aparam prabhuḥ  tasya abhidhyāyataḥ sargaḥ tiryakstrotaḥ bhyavartata
translated: Seeing that creation as ineffective, the lord thought of another.🔽As he was thinking, the creation flowed sideways.

original: yasmāt tiryak pravṛttaḥ sa tiryakstrotastataḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt tiryak pravṛttaḥ sa tiryakstrotaḥ tatas smṛtaḥ
translated: Since it flowed sideways, it is known as tirya-k-srotas.

analyzed: paśu ādayaḥ te vikhyātāḥ utpatha grāhiṇaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, those known as animals and others are said to be of the sideways flow.

analyzed: tam api asādhakam jñātvā sargam anyam sasarja ha
translated: Knowing that also to be unaccomplished, he created another creation.

analyzed: ūrdhvastrotaḥ iti proktaḥ deva sargaḥ tu sāttvikaḥ
translated: The divine creation, called the upward stream, is said to be of the sattva quality.

analyzed: te sukha pratibahulāḥ bahis antar ca na āvṛtāḥ
translated: They are full of happiness, not covered externally or internally,

analyzed: prakāśāḥ bahis antar ca svabhāvāt deva saṃjñitāḥ  tatas bidhāya āyataḥ tasya satya abhidhyāyinaḥ tadā
translated: luminous externally and internally by nature, called gods.🔽Then, from that unborn one, meditating on truth,

analyzed: prādurāsīt tadā avyaktāt arvāk strotaḥ tu sādhakaḥ
translated: the downward stream, the means of accomplishment, appeared from the unmanifest.

analyzed: te ca prakāśa bahulāḥ tama udriktāḥ rajaḥ adhikāḥ
translated: And they are mostly luminous, with tamas increased, with rajas predominant,

original: duḥ khotkaṭāḥ sattvayutā manuṣyāḥ parikīrtitā // / / //🔽taṃ dṛṣṭvā cāparaṃ sargamamanyad bhagavānajaḥ /
analyzed: duḥ kha utkaṭāḥ sattva yutāḥ manuṣyāḥ parikīrtitā  tam dṛṣṭvā ca aparam sargam amanyat bhagavān ajaḥ
translated: with sorrow prominent, and endowed with sattva, men are declared.🔽Seeing that other creation, the unborn Lord considered

analyzed: tasya abhidhyāyataḥ sargam sargaḥ bhūta ādikaḥ bhavat
translated: that creation, as he was meditating on it, the creation beginning with the elements came into being.

analyzed: te parigrāhiṇaḥ sarve saṃvibhāga ratāḥ punar
translated: All of them were without possessions, and again were devoted to sharing,

analyzed: khādanāḥ ca api aśīlāḥ ca bhūta ādyāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: and were eaters of earth, and were of bad conduct, the elements and others are declared.

original: ityete pañca kathitāḥ sargā vai dvijapuṅgavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti ete pañca kathitāḥ sargāḥ vai dvija puṅgavāḥ
translated: Thus these five creations are described, O best of Brahmins.

original: prathamo mahataḥ sargo vijñeyo brahmaṇastu saḥ /
analyzed: prathamaḥ mahataḥ sargaḥ vijñeyaḥ brahmaṇaḥ tu saḥ
translated: The first creation of Mahat should be known as that of Brahman.

original: tanmātrāṇāṃ dvitīyastu bhūtasargo hi sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tanmātrāṇām dvitīyaḥ tu bhūta sargaḥ hi sa smṛtaḥ
translated: The second creation is that of the Tanmatras, which is known as the creation of the elements.

analyzed: vaikārikaḥ tṛtīyaḥ tu sargaḥ aindriyakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The third creation is known as the Vaikarika creation, which consists of the sense organs.

analyzed: iti eṣa prākṛtaḥ sargaḥ saṃbhūtaḥ buddhi pūrvakaḥ
translated: Thus, this natural creation, which is devoid of consciousness, has come into being.

analyzed: mukhya sargaḥ caturthaḥ tu mukhyāḥ vai sthāvarāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The fourth creation is the principal one, and the principal ones are known as the immobile beings.

analyzed: tiryakstrotaḥ tu yaḥ proktaḥ tiryagyonyaḥ sa pañcamaḥ
translated: The one that is said to be the sideways-flowing creation is the fifth, which is the animal creation.

analyzed: tathā ūrdhvaḥ trotasām ṣaṣṭhaḥ deva sargaḥ tu sa smṛtaḥ
translated: The sixth creation of the gods is known as the upward-flowing creation.

original: tator'vākstrotasāṃ sargaḥ saptamaḥ sa tu mānuṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas urvākstrotasām sargaḥ saptamaḥ sa tu mānuṣaḥ
translated: Then, the seventh creation of the humans is the downward-flowing creation.

analyzed: aṣṭamaḥ bhautikaḥ sargaḥ bhūta ādīnām prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The eighth creation is declared to be the elemental creation of the elements and others.

analyzed: navamaḥ ca eva kaumāraḥ prākṛtāḥ vaikṛtāḥ tu ime
translated: And the ninth is the Kumara creation. These are the natural and modified creations.

original: prākṛtāstu trayaḥ pūrve sargāste 'buddhipūrvakāḥ /🔽buddhipūrvaṃ pravartante mukhyādyā munipuṅgavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prākṛtāḥ tu trayaḥ pūrve sargāḥ te buddhi pūrvakāḥ  buddhi pūrvam pravartante mukhya ādyāḥ muni puṅgavāḥ
translated: The first three creations are natural, and they are devoid of consciousness.🔽The principal ones and others, O best of sages, proceed with consciousness.

original: agre sasarja vai brahmā mānasānātmanaḥ samān /
analyzed: agre sasarja vai brahmā mānasān ātmanaḥ samān
translated: In the beginning, Brahma created the mind-born ones, who were like himself.

original: sanakaṃ sanātanaṃ caiva tathaiva ca sanandanam /
analyzed: sanakam sanātanam ca eva tathā eva ca sanandanam
translated: Sanaka, Sanatana, and also Sanandana,

analyzed: ṛbhum sanātkumāram ca pūrvam eva prajāpatiḥ
translated: To Rbhū, and to Kumāra from ancient times, the Lord of creatures (Prajāpati) first of all.

analyzed: pañca ete yoginaḥ viprāḥ param vairāgyam āsthitāḥ
translated: These five, O Brāhmaṇas, are Yogins, who have attained the highest detachment.

analyzed: īśvara āsakta manasaḥ na sṛṣṭau dadhire matim
translated: Their minds are attached to the Lord, and they have not set their minds on creation.

analyzed: teṣu evam nirapekṣeṣu loka sṛṣṭau prajāpatiḥ
translated: When they were thus indifferent to creation, the Lord of creatures (Prajāpati),

analyzed: mumoha māyayā sadyas māyinaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ  tam bodhayāmāsa sutam jagat māyaḥ mahā muniḥ
translated: Was suddenly deluded by the illusion of the Supreme Lord, the magician.
The great sage, the illusion of the world, Nārāyaṇa, the great yogi, who delights the minds of the yogis, awakened his son.

analyzed: bodhitaḥ tena viśvātmā tatāpa paramam tapaḥ

original: sa tapyamāno bhagavān na kiñcit pratipadyata // / / //
analyzed: sa tapyamānaḥ bhagavān na kiñcid pratipadyata

analyzed: tatas dīrgheṇa kālena dukhāt krodhaḥ vyajāyata
translated: Then, after a long time, anger arose from sorrow.

analyzed: krodha āviṣṭasya netrābhyām prāpatan aśru bindavaḥ  bhrukuṭī kuṭilāt tasya lalāṭāt parameśvaraḥ

analyzed: samutpannaḥ mahādevaḥ śaraṇyaḥ nīlalohitaḥ

analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavān īśaḥ tejaḥ rāśiḥ sanātanaḥ

analyzed: yam prapaśyanti vidvāṃsaḥ sva ātma stham parameśvaram

analyzed: tāma bhagavān brahmā sṛja imāḥ vividhāḥ prajāḥ
translated: The Blessed Lord Brahma created these various beings.

analyzed: niśamya bhagavān vākyam śaṅkaraḥ dharmavāhanaḥ
translated: Having heard those words, the Blessed Lord Shankara, the bearer of Dharma,

analyzed: sva ātmanā rudrān sasarja manasā śivaḥ

analyzed: nivārya ca tadā rudram sasarja kamalodbhavaḥ
translated: Having thus restrained Rudra, the Lotus-born one created

analyzed: sthāna abhimāninaḥ sarvān gadataḥ tān nibodhata  apaḥ gniḥ antarikṣam ca dyauḥ vāyuḥ pṛthivī tathā  nadyaḥ samudrāḥ śailāḥ ca vṛkṣāḥ vīrudhaḥ eva ca

translated: Dakṣa, Atri, Vasiṣṭha, Dharma, and Saṃkalpa.

translated: From his head, the god created Aṅgiras, and from his heart, Bhṛgu.

analyzed: śrotrābhyām atri nāmānam dharmam ca vyavasāyataḥ

analyzed: saṃkalpam ca eva saṃkalpāt sarva loka pitāmahaḥ

analyzed: iti ete brahmaṇā sṛṣṭāḥ sādhakāḥ gṛhamedhinaḥ

analyzed: āsthāya mānavam rūpam dharmaḥ taiḥ saṃpravartitaḥ

analyzed: tatas deva asura pitṛn manuṣyān ca catuṣṭayam
translated: Then, desiring to create the four groups of gods, asuras, ancestors, and humans,

analyzed: sisṛkṣuḥ ambhāṃsi etāni svam ātmānam ayūyujat
translated: he united with his own self, these elements.

analyzed: utsasarja asurān sṛṣṭvā tām tanum puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Having created the Asuras, that best of beings abandoned that body.

analyzed: devaḥ tanum anyām agṛhṇata  tatas sya mukhataḥ devāḥ dīvyataḥ saṃprajajñire
translated: The god then took up another body consisting of the quality of goodness alone.🔽Then from the mouth of him who was sporting, the gods were born.

analyzed: tyaktā sā api tanuḥ tena sattva prāyam abhūt dinam
translated: And that body, which was full of goodness, was abandoned by him, and the day came into being.

analyzed: tasmāt ahar dharma yuktāḥ devatāḥ samupāsate
translated: Therefore, on that day, the gods who are devoted to dharma worship the gods.

analyzed: sattva mātra ātmikām eva tatas jagṛhe tanum
translated: Then he took up another body consisting of the quality of goodness alone.

original: pitṛvanmanyamānasya pitaraḥ saṃprajajñire // / / //🔽utsasarja pitṛn sṛṣṭvā tatastāmapi viśvasṛk /
analyzed: pitṛ vat manyamānasya pitaraḥ saṃprajajñire  utsasarja pitṛn sṛṣṭvā tatas tām api viśvasṛj
translated: And from him who regarded the Pitris as his own self, the Pitris were born.🔽Having created the Pitris, the creator of the universe abandoned that body also.

analyzed: sā apaviddhā tanuḥ tena sadyas sandhyā vyajāyata
translated: And that body, as soon as it was abandoned by him, became the evening.

analyzed: tasmāt ahar devatānām rātriḥ syāt deva vidviṣām
translated: Therefore, the day belongs to the gods, and the night to the enemies of the gods.

original: tayormadhye pitṝṇāṃ tu mūrtiḥ sandhyā garīyasī // / / //
analyzed: tayoḥ madhye pitṝṇām tu mūrtiḥ sandhyā garīyasī
translated: Between them, the form of the ancestors, the twilight, is greater.

analyzed: tasmāt deva asurāḥ sarve manavaḥ mānavāḥ tathā  upāsate tadā yuktāḥ rātri ahnoḥ madhyamām tanum
translated: Therefore, all gods, demons, Manus, and humans,🔽Concentrated, worship that middle body of night and day.

analyzed: rajaḥ mātra ātmikām brahmā tanum anyām agṛhṇata
translated: Brahmā took up another body consisting of only rajas.

analyzed: tatas sya jajñire putrāḥ manuṣyāḥ rajasā āvṛtāḥ
translated: Then his sons, humans, covered by rajas, were born.

original: tāmapyāśu sa tatyāja tanuṃ sadyaḥ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: tām api āśu sa tatyāja tanum sadyas prajāpatiḥ
translated: That Prajāpati quickly abandoned that body immediately.

analyzed: jyotstrā sā ca abhavat viprāḥ prāk sandhyā yā a bidhīyate
translated: O Brahmins, that became the dawn, which is spoken of as the previous twilight.

original: tataḥ sa bhagavān brahmā saṃprāpya dvijapuṅgavāḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa bhagavān brahmā saṃprāpya dvija puṅgavāḥ
translated: Then that Lord Brahmā, O best of the twice-born,

analyzed: mūrti tamaḥ rajaḥ prāyām punar eva abhyayūyujat  andhakāre kṣudhā āviṣṭāḥ rākṣasāḥ tasya jajñire

analyzed: sarpāḥ yakṣāḥ tathā būtāḥ gandharvāḥ saṃprajajñire
translated: Serpents, Yakṣas, and spirits, and Gandharvas were born.

analyzed: rajaḥ tamobhyām āviṣṭān tatas nyān asṛjat prabhuḥ
translated: Then the Lord created others possessed by rajas and tamas.

analyzed: vayāṃsi vayasaḥ sṛṣṭvā avayaḥ vakṣasaḥ sṛjat
translated: Having created birds from his wings, he created birds from his chest.

analyzed: mukhataḥ jān sasarja anyān udarāt gāḥ ca nirmame  padbhyām ca aśvān sa mātaṅgān rāsabhān gavayān mṛgān

translated: Camels, mules, and other species,

translated: And from his hair were born the domestic animals, fruits, and roots.

analyzed: sāmāni jāgatam chanda stomam saptadaśam tathā

analyzed: ekaviśam atharvāṇam āptoryāmāṇam eva ca

analyzed: anuṣṭubham sa vairājam uttarāt asṛjat mukhāt

analyzed: uccāvacāni bhūtāni gātrebhyaḥ tasya jajñire
translated: From his body were born the various beings, high and low,

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ hi prajā sargam sṛjataḥ tu prajāpateḥ

analyzed: svāyaṃbhuvaḥ manuḥ dhārmāt munīnām
translated: having first spoken the laws to the sages,

analyzed: śrutvā ca anye munayaḥ tad mukhāt dharmam uttamam
translated: and others also having heard that excellent law from his mouth,

original: cakrurdharmapratiṣṭhārthaṃ dharmaśāstrāṇi caiva hi // / / //🔽teṣu cāntarhiteṣvevaṃ yugānteṣu maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: cakruḥ dharma pratiṣṭhā artham dharma śāstrāṇi ca eva hi  teṣu ca antarhiteṣu evam yuga anteṣu mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: and for the sake of establishing the law, they also composed the Dharma Shastras.🔽And when they disappeared in this way at the end of the yuga,

original: brahmaṇo vacanāt tāni kariṣyanti yuge yuge // / / //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ vacanāt tāni kariṣyanti yuge yuge
translated: the great sages, by the word of Brahma, will make them again in each yuga.

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa purāṇāni vyāsena kathitāni tu
translated: The eighteen Puranas were narrated by Vyasa,

analyzed: niyogāt brahmaṇaḥ rājan teṣu dharmaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: the law is established in them, O king, by the command of Brahma.

analyzed: anyāni upapurāṇāni tad śiṣyaiḥ kathitāni tu
translated: The other minor Puranas were narrated by his disciples,

original: yuge yuge 'tra sarveṣāṃ kartā vai dharmaśāstravit // / / //
analyzed: yuge yuge sarveṣām kartā vai dharma śāstra vid
translated: and in each age, the knower of the Dharma Shastras should perform all of them.

original: śikṣā kalpo vyākaraṇaṃ niruktaṃ chanda eva ca /
analyzed: śikṣā kalpaḥ vyākaraṇam niruktam chandaḥ eva ca
translated: The fourteen branches of knowledge are: शिक्षा शिक्षा, कल्पः कल्पः, व्याकरणं व्याकरणम्, निरुक्तं निरुक्तम्, छन्दः छन्दः,

analyzed: jyotiḥ śāstram nyāya vidyā mīmāṃsā ca upabṛṃhaṇam
translated: The science of light, the knowledge of logic, and Mimamsa are nourishing.

analyzed: evam caturdaśa etāni vidyā sthānāni sattama
translated: Thus, O best of men, these fourteen branches of knowledge,

analyzed: catur vedaiḥ saha uktāni dharmaḥ na anyatra vidyate
translated: along with the four Vedas, are spoken of; Dharma is not found elsewhere.

analyzed: evam paitāmaham dharmam manu vyāsa ādayaḥ param
translated: Thus Manu, Vyasa and others, by my command, establish the highest duty of the grandfathers,

analyzed: sthāpayanti mama ādeśāt yāvat ābhūtasaṃplavam
translated: until the end of all things.

original: brahmaṇā saha te sarve saṃprāpte pratisaṃcare /
analyzed: brahmaṇā saha te sarve saṃprāpte pratisaṃcare
translated: All of them, together with Brahma, when the time of dissolution comes,

analyzed: parasya ante kṛtātmānaḥ praviśanti param padam
translated: having their souls purified at the end of the highest (dissolution), enter the highest state.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena dharma artham vedam āśrayet
translated: Therefore, by all means, one should resort to the Veda for the sake of Dharma.

original: dharmeṇa sahitaṃ jñānaṃ paraṃ brahma prakāśayet // / / //
analyzed: dharmeṇa sahitam jñānam param brahma prakāśayet
translated: Knowledge united with Dharma will reveal the highest Brahman.

original: ye tu saṅgān parityajya māmeva śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: ye tu saṅgān parityajya mām eva śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: But those who, renouncing attachments, have taken refuge in Me alone,

analyzed: upāsate sadā bhaktyā yogam aiśvaram āsthitāḥ
translated: who always worship with devotion, established in the divine Yoga,

original: sarvabhūtadayāvantaḥ śāntā dāntā vimatsarāḥ /🔽amānino buddhimantastāpasāḥ śaṃsitavratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarva bhūta dayāvantaḥ śāntāḥ dāntāḥ vimatsarāḥ  amāninaḥ buddhimantaḥ tāpasāḥ śaṃsita vratāḥ
translated: who are compassionate towards all beings, peaceful, self-controlled, free from envy,🔽free from pride, intelligent, ascetics, of praiseworthy vows,

analyzed: mad cittāḥ mad gata prāṇāḥ mad jñāna kathane ratāḥ
translated: whose minds are fixed on Me, whose life is devoted to Me, who delight in narrating My knowledge,

original: saṃnyāsino gṛhasthāśca vanasthā brahmacāriṇaḥ // / / //🔽teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ māyātattvasamutthitam /
analyzed: saṃnyāsinaḥ gṛhasthāḥ ca vanasthāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ  teṣām nitya abhiyuktānām māyā tattva samutthitam
translated: whether they are renunciates, householders, forest dwellers, or celibate students,

original: nāśayāmi tamaḥ kṛtsnaṃ jñānadīpane mā cirāt // / / //
analyzed: nāśayāmi tamaḥ kṛtsnam jñāna dīpane mā cirāt
translated: for them who are always devoted, I shall quickly destroy the entire darkness arising from the principle of Maya, by kindling the lamp of knowledge.

analyzed: te su nirdhūta tamasaḥ jñānena ekena mad mayāḥ
translated: They, having their darkness of ignorance completely dispelled, being full of knowledge, and having only one form,

original: sadānandāstu saṃsāre na jāyante punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sat ānandāḥ tu saṃsāre na jāyante punar punar
translated: and being ever blissful, are not born again and again in the world.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prakāreṇa mad bhaktaḥ mad parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, in every way, a devotee of Mine, devoted to Me,

analyzed: mām eva arcaya sarvatra menayā saha saṃgataḥ
translated: united with Menaka, worship only Me everywhere.

analyzed: aśaktaḥ yadi me dhyātum aiśvaram rūpam avyayam
translated: If you are unable to meditate on My imperishable divine form,

original: tato me sakalaṃ rūpaṃ kālādyaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja // / / //
analyzed: tatas me sakalam rūpam kāla ādyam śaraṇam vraja
translated: then take refuge in My complete form, which is the time and other (forms).

original: yad yat svarūpaṃ me tāta manaso gocaraṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yat yat sva rūpam me tāta manasaḥ gocaram bhavet
translated: Whatever form of Mine, O son, may come within the range of your mind,

analyzed: tad niṣṭhaḥ tatparaḥ bhūtvā tad arcana paraḥ bhava
translated: being devoted to that, being intent on that, be engaged in worshipping that.

original: yattu me niṣkalaṃ rūpaṃ cinmātraṃ kevalaṃ śivam /
analyzed: yat tu me niṣkalam rūpam cit mātram kevalam śivam
translated: But that formless form of Mine, which is pure consciousness alone, which is auspicious,

analyzed: sarva upādhi vinirmuktam anantam amṛtam param
translated: free from all limitations, infinite, immortal, and supreme,

analyzed: jñānena ekena tat labhyam kleśena paramam padam
translated: that supreme state is attained only through knowledge, through great effort.

analyzed: jñānam eva prapaśyantaḥ mām eva praviśanti te
translated: Those who see only knowledge enter into Me alone.

analyzed: tad buddhayaḥ tad ātmānaḥ tad niṣṭhāḥ tad parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Those whose intellects are fixed on that, whose souls are fixed on that, who are devoted to that, who are intent on that,

analyzed: gacchanti apunarāvṛttim jñāna nirdhūta kalmaṣāḥ
translated: having their sins destroyed by knowledge, go to the state from which there is no return.

analyzed: mām an āśritya paramam nirvāṇam amalam padam
translated: Without resorting to me, the supreme, immaculate state of nirvana,

original: prāpyate na hi rājendra tato māṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja // / / //🔽ekatvena pṛthaktvena tathā cobhayato 'pi vā /
analyzed: prāpyate na hi rāja indra tatas mām śaraṇam vraja  ekatvena pṛthaktvena tathā vā
translated: Without resorting to me, O king of kings, the highest state of liberation, which is free from impurities, cannot be attained. Therefore, take refuge in me.

original: māmupāsya mahārāja tato yāsyāsi tatpadam // / / //🔽māmanāśritya tat tattvaṃ svabhāvavimalaṃ śivam /
analyzed: mām upāsya mahā rāja tatas yāsyāsi tat padam  mām an āśritya tat tattvam svabhāva vimalam śivam
translated: By meditating on me as one, as separate, or as both, O great king, you will then attain that state.

original: jñāyate na hi rājendra tato māṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja // / / //🔽tasmāt tvamakṣaraṃ rūpaṃ nityaṃ cārūpamaiśvaram /
analyzed: jñāyate na hi rāja indra tatas mām śaraṇam vraja  tasmāt tvam akṣaram rūpam nityam ca arūpam aiśvaram
translated: Without resorting to me, that reality, which is pure by nature and auspicious, cannot be known, O king of kings. Therefore, take refuge in me.

original: ārādhaya prayatnena tato bandhaṃ prahāsyasi // / / //🔽karmaṇā manasā vācā śivaṃ sarvatra sarvadā /
analyzed: ārādhaya prayatnena tatas bandham prahāsyasi  karmaṇā manasā vācā śivam sarvatra sarvadā
translated: Therefore, you should diligently worship the imperishable form and the eternal formless nature of the Lord. Then you will abandon bondage.

original: samārādhaya bhāvena tato yāsyasi tatpadam // / / //🔽na vai paśyanti tat tattvaṃ mohitā mama māyayā /
analyzed: samārādhaya bhāvena tatas yāsyasi tad padam  na vai paśyanti tat tattvam mohitāḥ mama māyayā
translated: By action, mind, and speech, always worship Shiva everywhere with devotion. Then you will attain that state.

analyzed: anādi anantam paramam maheśvaram ajam śivam
translated: They who are deluded by my Maya do not see that reality, which is beginningless, endless, supreme, unborn, and auspicious.

analyzed: sarva bhūta ātma bhūta stham sarva ādhāram nirañjanam
translated: It is the soul of all beings, the support of all, free from impurities,
eternal bliss, free from appearances, attributeless, beyond darkness.

analyzed: advaitam acalam brahma niṣkalam niṣprapañcakam
translated: The non-dual, unmoving Brahman, the partless, the free from conceptual elaboration,

analyzed: sva saṃvedyam avedyam tat pare vyomni vyavasthitam
translated: That which is to be known by oneself, which is unknowable, is established in the supreme sky.

original: sūkṣmeṇa tamasā nityaṃ veṣṭitā mama māyayā /
analyzed: sūkṣmeṇa tamasā nityam veṣṭitāḥ mama māyayā
translated: Always enveloped by my subtle tamas, and by my Maya,

original: saṃsārasāgare ghore jāyante ca punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃsāra sāgare ghore jāyante ca punar punar
translated: They are born again and again in the terrible ocean of worldly existence.

original: bhaktyā tvananyayā rājan samyag jñānena caiva hi /
analyzed: bhaktyā tu ananyayā rājan samyak jñānena ca eva hi
translated: By means of undivided devotion, O king, and by means of perfect knowledge,

original: anveṣṭavyaṃ hi tad brahma janmabandhanivṛttaye // / / //🔽ahaṅkāraṃ ca mātsaryaṃ kāmaṃ krodhaṃ parigraham /
analyzed: anveṣṭavyam hi tat brahma janma bandha nivṛttaye  ahaṅkāram ca mātsaryam kāmam krodham parigraham
translated: That Brahman should be sought after, for the cessation of the bondage of birth.🔽Having abandoned egoism, envy, desire, anger, possession,

analyzed: adharma abhiniveśam ca tyaktvā vairāgyam āsthitaḥ
translated: And attachment to unrighteousness, having resorted to detachment,

analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu ca ātmānam sarva bhūtāni ca ātmani
translated: And having contemplated the Self in all beings, and all beings in the Self,

analyzed: anvīkṣya ca ātmanā ātmānam brahma bhūyāya kalpate
translated: And having contemplated the Self by the Self, one becomes fit for becoming Brahman.

analyzed: brahma bhūtaḥ prasanna ātmā sarva bhūta abhaya pradaḥ
translated: Having become Brahman, with a delighted soul, granting fearlessness to all beings,

analyzed: aiśvarīm paramām bhaktim vindeta ananya gāminīm
translated: One attains the supreme devotion to the Goddess, which goes nowhere else.

analyzed: vīkṣate tat param tattvam aiśvaram brahma niṣkalam
translated: One beholds that supreme truth, the partless Brahman of the Lord.

analyzed: sarva saṃsāra nirmuktaḥ brahmaṇeyavā avatiṣṭhate
translated: Liberated from all worldly existence, one abides in Brahman.

original: brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāyaṃ parasya paramaḥ śivaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ hi pratiṣṭhā ayam parasya paramaḥ śivaḥ
translated: For this is the support of Brahman, the Supreme, the highest Shiva.

analyzed: anantasya avyayasya ekaḥ sva ātma ādhāraḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: The one support of the Self of the infinite and imperishable Mahesvara.

analyzed: jñānena karma yogena bhakti yogena vā nṛpa
translated: By knowledge, by the yoga of action, or by the yoga of devotion, O king,

analyzed: sarva saṃsāra mukti artham īśvaram satatam śraya
translated: Always resort to the Lord for the sake of liberation from all worldly existence.

analyzed: eṣa guhya upadeśaḥ te mayā dattaḥ girīśvara
translated: This secret instruction has been given to you by me, O Lord of the mountains.

analyzed: anvīkṣya ca etat akhilam yathā iṣṭam kartum arhasi
translated: Having examined all this, you should do as you wish.

original: ahaṃ vai yācitā devaiḥ saṃjātā parameśvarāt /
analyzed: aham vai yācitā devaiḥ saṃjātā parameśvarāt
translated: I was born from the Supreme Lord, requested by the gods,

analyzed: vinindya dakṣam pitaram maheśvara vinindakam
translated: Having condemned Daksha, my father, who condemned Mahesvara.

analyzed: dharma saṃsthāpana arthāya tava ārādhana kāraṇāt
translated: For the sake of establishing Dharma and for the purpose of worshipping you,

analyzed: menā deha samutpannā tvām eva pitaram śritā
translated: Born from the body of Mena, I have resorted to you alone as my father.

original: sa tvaṃ niyogād devasya brahmaṇaḥ paramātmanaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam niyogāt devasya brahmaṇaḥ paramātmanaḥ
translated: Therefore, by the command of the god Brahma, the Supreme Self,

analyzed: mām rudrāya svayaṃvara samāgame
translated: You will give me to Rudra at the gathering of the Svayamvara.

original: tatsaṃbandhācca te rājan sarve devāḥ savāsavāḥ /
analyzed: tad saṃbandhāt ca te rājan sarve devāḥ sa vāsavāḥ
translated: And by that connection, O king, all the gods with Indra,

original: tvāṃ namasyanti vai tāta prasīdati ca śaṅkaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvām namasyanti vai tāta prasīdati ca śaṅkaraḥ
translated: Worship you, O father, and Shankara is pleased.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena mām viddhi īśvara gocarām
translated: Therefore, with all efforts, know me as the object of the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: saṃpūjya devam īśānam śaraṇyam śaraṇam vraja
translated: Having worshipped Lord Isha, the protector, go for refuge.

analyzed: saḥ evam uktaḥ bhagavān devadevyā girīśvaraḥ
translated: The Blessed Lord, the Lord of the Mountains, thus addressed by the Goddess of the Gods,

analyzed: praṇamya śirasā devīm prāñjaliḥ punar abravīt
translated: bowing his head to the Goddess with folded hands, spoke again.

original: vistareṇa maheśāni yogaṃ māheśvaraṃ param /🔽jñānaṃ caivātmano yogaṃ sādhanāni pracakṣva me // / / //
analyzed: vistareṇa maheśāni yogam māheśvaram param  jñānam ca eva ātmanaḥ yogam sādhanāni pracakṣva me
translated: O Maheshani, please explain to me in detail the supreme Maheshavara Yoga,🔽the knowledge of the Self, and the means of Yoga.

analyzed: tasya etat paramam jñānam ātma yogam anuttamam
translated: The Lord then fully explained to him this supreme knowledge, the excellent Yoga of the Self,

original: yathāvad vyājahāreśāsādhanānica vistarāt // / / //🔽niśamya vadanāmbhojād girīndro lokapūjitaḥ /
analyzed: yathāvat vyājahāra īśā sādhanāni ca vistarāt  niśamya vadana ambhojāt girīndraḥ loka pūjitaḥ
translated: and the means of practice in detail.🔽Having heard this supreme knowledge of the Mother of the World from her lotus face,

analyzed: lokamātuḥ param jñānam yoga āsaktaḥ bhavat punar
translated: the Lord of the Mountains, worshipped by the world, devoted to Yoga, became absorbed in it again.

analyzed: pradadau ca maheśāya pārvatīm bhāgya gauravāt
translated: And out of respect for his good fortune, he gave Parvati to Maheshvara,

original: niyogād brahmaṇaḥ sādhvīṃ devānāṃ caiva saṃnidhau // / / //
analyzed: niyogāt brahmaṇaḥ sādhvīm devānām ca eva saṃnidhau
translated: the chaste lady, by the command of Brahma, in the presence of the gods.

analyzed: yaḥ imam paṭhate dhyāyam devyāḥ māhātmya kīrtanam
translated: He who reads this chapter, which describes the greatness of the Goddess,

analyzed: śivasya saṃnidhau bhaktyā suciḥ tad bhāva bhāvitaḥ
translated: with devotion, pure and filled with that feeling, in the presence of Shiva,

analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ divya yoga samanvitaḥ
translated: He becomes free from all sins, endowed with divine yoga,

analyzed: ullaṅghya brahmaṇaḥ lokan devyāḥ sthānam avāpnuyāt
translated: and having transcended the world of Brahma, he attains the abode of the Goddess.

analyzed: yaḥ ca etat paṭhate stotram brāhmaṇānām samīpatas
translated: One who recites this hymn in the presence of Brahmins,

analyzed: devyāḥ samāhita manāḥ sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: with a concentrated mind on the Goddess, becomes free from all sins.

analyzed: nāmnām aṣṭa sahastram tu devyāḥ yat samudīritam
translated: The eight thousand names of the Goddess that have been uttered,

analyzed: jñātvā arka maṇḍala gatām saṃbhāvya parameśvarīm
translated: knowing them, visualizing the Supreme Goddess residing in the orb of the sun,

analyzed: abhyarcya gandha puṣpa ādyaiḥ bhakti yoga samanvitaḥ
translated: worshipping with devotion and concentration, with devotion and yoga,

original: saṃsmaran paramaṃ bhāvaṃ devyā māheśvaraṃ param // / / //
analyzed: saṃsmaran paramam bhāvam devyāḥ māheśvaram param
translated: remembering the supreme state of the Goddess, the supreme state of Mahesvara,

analyzed: an anya mānasaḥ nityam japet āmaraṇāt dvijaḥ
translated: a Brahmin should recite them with an undivided mind until death.

analyzed: saḥ nta kāle smṛtim labdhvā aparam brahma adhigacchati
translated: At the time of death, having regained his memory, he attains the supreme Brahman.

original: athavā jāyate vipro brāhmaṇānāṃ kule śucau /
analyzed: athavā jāyate vipraḥ brāhmaṇānām kule śucau
translated: Or he is born in the pure family of Brahmins,

analyzed: pūrva saṃskāra māhātmyāt brahma vidyām avāpya saḥ
translated: by the power of his previous impressions, having attained the knowledge of Brahman,

original: saṃprāpya yogaṃ paramaṃ divyaṃ tat pārameśvaram /
analyzed: saṃprāpya yogam paramam divyam tat pārameśvaram
translated: having attained that supreme and divine yoga of the Supreme Lord,

analyzed: śāntaḥ sarva gātaḥ bhūtvā śiva sāyujyam ānapnuyāt
translated: becoming tranquil and all-pervading, he attains union with Shiva.

analyzed: pratyekam ca atha nāmāni juhuyāt savana trayam
translated: And for each, one should offer oblations with the names during the three savanas.

analyzed: pūtanā ādi kṛtaiḥ deṣaiḥ graha doṣaiḥ ca mucyate
translated: One is freed from the faults created by Putana and others, and from the faults of the planets.

analyzed: japet vā aharahar nityam saṃvatsaram atandritaḥ
translated: One should recite daily, without laziness, for a year.

analyzed: śrī kāmaḥ pārvatīm devīm pūjayitvā vidhānataḥ
translated: One who desires prosperity, having worshipped Goddess Parvati according to the prescribed method,

analyzed: saṃpūjya pārśvatas śaṃbhum trinetram bhakti saṃyutaḥ
translated: having worshipped Shankara, the three-eyed one, with devotion,

original: labhate mahatīṃ lakṣmīṃ mahādevaprasādataḥ // / / //🔽tasmāt sarvaprayatnena japtavyaṃ hi dvijātibhiḥ /
analyzed: labhate mahatīm lakṣmīm mahādeva prasādataḥ  tasmāt sarva prayatnena japtavyam hi dvijātibhiḥ
translated: obtains great wealth by the grace of Mahadeva.

analyzed: sarva pāpa ānoda artham devyāḥ nāma sahastrakam
translated: Therefore, the thousand names of the Goddess should be recited by the twice-born with all efforts.🔽For the sake of destroying all sins.

analyzed: prasaṅgāt kathitam viprāḥ devyāḥ māhātmyam uttamam
translated: O Brahmins, the excellent greatness of the Goddess has been told incidentally.

analyzed: atas param prajā sargam bhṛgu ādīnām nibodhata
translated: Hereafter, understand the creation of Bhrigu and others.

original: iti śrīkūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pūrvavibhāge ekādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ🔽sūta uvāca🔽bhṛgoḥ khyātyāṃ samutpannā lakṣmīrnārāyaṇapriyā /🔽devau dhātāvidhātārau merorjāmātarau tathā // / / //
analyzed: iti śrī kūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryām saṃhitāyām pūrva vibhāge ekādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ 🔽sūtaḥ uvāca 🔽bhṛgoḥ khyātyām samutpannā lakṣmīḥ nārāyaṇa priyā 🔽devau dhātāvidhātārau meroḥ jāmātarau tathā
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter in the Pūrva Bhāga of Śrī Kūrma Purāṇa.

analyzed: āyatiḥ niyatiḥ meroḥ kanye ca eva mahātmanaḥ
translated: The two daughters of the great Meru, Aayati and Niyati,

analyzed: dhātāvidhātroḥ te bhārye tayoḥ jātau sutau ubhau
translated: were the wives of Dhata and Vidhata. They had two sons each.

analyzed: prāṇaḥ ca eva mṛkaṇḍuḥ ca mārkaṇḍeyaḥ mṛkaṇḍutaḥ
translated: Pranas and Mrikandu were the sons of Dhata and Vidhata. Markandeya was born from Mrikandu.

analyzed: varṣeṣu eteṣu tān putrān abhiṣicya narādhipaḥ
translated: Having consecrated those sons in these Varṣas, the king of men,

original: saṃsārakaṣṭatāṃ jñātvā tapastepe vanaṃ gataḥ // / / //🔽himāhvayaṃ tu yasyaitannābherāsīnmahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāra kaṣṭa tām jñātvā tapaḥ tepe vanam gataḥ  himāhvayam tu yasya etat nābheḥ āsīt mahātmanaḥ
translated: knowing the difficulty of worldly life, went to the forest and practiced austerities.🔽The Himavat mountain was the navel of that great-souled one.

original: tasyarṣabho 'bhavat putro marudevyāṃ mahādyutiḥ // / / //🔽ṛṣabhād bharato jajñe vīraḥ putraśatāgrajaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ṛṣabhaḥ bhavat putraḥ marudevyām mahā dyutiḥ  ṛṣabhāt bharataḥ jajñe vīraḥ putra śata agrajaḥ
translated: From him, the very lustrous Ṛṣabha was born to Marudevi.🔽From Ṛṣabha was born the heroic Bharata, the eldest of a hundred sons.

analyzed: saḥ bhiṣicya ṛṣabhaḥ putram bharatam pṛthivīpatiḥ
translated: Having consecrated his son Bharata as the lord of the earth, Ṛṣabha,

analyzed: vānaprastha āśramam gatvā tapaḥ tepe yathāvidhi
translated: went to the hermitage of Vānaprastha and practiced austerities according to the rules.

analyzed: tapasā karṣitaḥ tyartham kṛśaḥ dhamani saṃtataḥ
translated: He became very emaciated by austerities, lean and full of veins.

analyzed: jñāna yoga rataḥ bhūtvā mahā pāśupataḥ bhavat
translated: Becoming devoted to the yoga of knowledge, he became a great Pashupati.

analyzed: sumatiḥ bharatasya abhūt putraḥ parama dhārmikaḥ
translated: Sumati was the son of Bharata, who was extremely righteous.

analyzed: sumateḥ taijasaḥ tasmāt indridyumnaḥ vyajāyata
translated: From Sumati, Taisha was born, from him Indradhyumna was born.

analyzed: parameṣṭhī sutaḥ tasmāt pratīhāraḥ tad anvayaḥ
translated: Parameshthi was his son, and Pratihara was in his lineage.

analyzed: pratihartā iti vikhyātaḥ utpannaḥ tasya ca ātmajaḥ  bhavaḥ tasmāt atha udgīthaḥ prastāvaḥ tad sutaḥ bhavat
translated: His son, known as Pratiharta, was born.🔽From him, Bhava, then Udgitha, and Prastha were born.

analyzed: pṛthuḥ tatas tatas raktaḥ raktasya api gayaḥ sutaḥ
translated: From him, Rakta was born, and from Rakta, Gaya was born.

analyzed: naraḥ gayasya tanayaḥ tasya putraḥ virāj abhūt
translated: Nara was Gaya's son, and his son was Viraj.

analyzed: tasya putraḥ mahā vīryaḥ dhīmān tasmāt ajāyata
translated: His son was greatly valorous and wise, from whom Dhimat was born.

analyzed: tatas ca abhūt bhauvanaḥ tad sutaḥ bhavat
translated: From him, Mahanta was born, and his son was Bhauvana.

analyzed: tvaṣṭā tvaṣṭuḥ ca virajaḥ rajaḥ tasya api abhūt sutaḥ
translated: Tvashtri was born from Tvashtri, and Viraja was born from him.

analyzed: śatajit rajasaḥ tasya jajñe putra śatam dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, from Rajas, Shatajit was born, and he had a hundred sons.

analyzed: teṣām pradhānaḥ balavān viśvajyotiḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: Among them, the powerful one is known as Vishvajit.

original: ārādhya devaṃ brahmāṇaṃ kṣemakaṃ nāma pārthivam /
analyzed: ārādhya devam brahmāṇam kṣemakam nāma pārthivam
translated: Having propitiated Lord Brahma, he became the king named Kshemaka.

original: asūta putraṃ dharmajñaṃ mahābāhumarindamam // / / //🔽ete purastād rājāno mahāsattvā mahaujasaḥ /
analyzed: asūta putram dharma jñam mahā bāhum arindamam  ete purastāt rājānaḥ mahā sattvāḥ mahā ojasaḥ
translated: Having propitiated the god Brahma, he begot a son named Kshemaka, a king who was righteous, mighty-armed, and a conqueror of enemies.🔽These were the kings of the past, of great spirit and great prowess.

analyzed: eṣām vaṃśa prasūtaiḥ ca bhuktā iyam pṛthivī purā
translated: The earth was formerly ruled by those born in their lineage.

original: iti śrīkūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryāṃ saṃhitāyāṃ pūrvavibhāge aṣṭātriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī kūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryām saṃhitāyām pūrva vibhāge aṣṭātriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-eighth chapter in the first section of the Kurma Purana.

original: sūta uvāca🔽ataḥ paraṃ pravakṣyāmi saṃkṣepeṇa dvijottamāḥ /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca  atas param pravakṣyāmi saṃkṣepeṇa dvijottamāḥ
translated: Suta said:

original: trailokyasyāsya mānaṃ vo na śakyaṃ vistareṇa tu // / / //🔽bhūrloko 'tha bhuvarlokaḥ svarloko 'tha mahastataḥ /
analyzed: trailokyasya asya mānam vaḥ na śakyam vistareṇa tu  tha bhuvarlokaḥ svar lokaḥ tha mahaḥ tatas
translated: O best of Brahmins, I will now tell you briefly about the measurements of these three worlds, which cannot be described in detail.

original: janastapaśca satyaṃ ca lokāstvaṇḍodbhavā matāḥ // / / //🔽sūryācandramasoryāvat kiraṇairavabhāsate /
analyzed: janaḥ tapaḥ ca satyam ca lokāḥ tu aṇḍa udbhavāḥ matāḥ  sūryācandramasoḥ yāvat kiraṇaiḥ avabhāsate
translated: The worlds are Bhu, Bhuvar, Svar, Maha, Jana, Tapas, and Satya, which are considered to have originated from the cosmic egg.

original: tāvad bhūrloka ākhyātaḥ purāṇe dvijapuṅgavāḥ // / / //🔽yāvatpramāṇo bhūrloko vistarāt parimaṇḍalāt /
analyzed: tāvat bhūrlokaḥ ākhyātaḥ purāṇe dvija puṅgavāḥ  yāvat pramāṇaḥ bhūrlokaḥ vistarāt parimaṇḍalāt
translated: O best of Brahmins, the earth is said to extend as far as the rays of the sun and moon shine.🔽O best of Brahmins, the earth extends as far as the circumference of the cosmic egg.

analyzed: tāvān syāt maṇḍalāt bhāskarasya tu
translated: The Bhuvar world extends as far as the circumference of the sun's orb, just as the earth extends in circumference.

analyzed: ūrdhvam yat maṇḍalāt vyoma dhruvaḥ yāvat vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The region above the circle of fire, extending up to the pole-star,

original: svarlokaḥ sa samākhyātastatra vāyostu nemayaḥ // / / //🔽āvahaḥ pravahaścaiva tathaivānuvahaḥ paraḥ /🔽saṃvaho vivahaścātha tadūrdhvaṃ syāt parāvahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svarlokaḥ sa samākhyātaḥ tatra vāyoḥ tu nemayaḥ  āvahaḥ pravahaḥ ca eva tathā eva anuvahaḥ paraḥ  saṃvahaḥ vivahaḥ ca atha tad ūrdhvam syāt parāvahaḥ
translated: is called the Svarloka (heavenly world). There are the rings of Vayu (wind).🔽The rings of Vayu are seven: Avah, Pravah, Anuvaha,

original: tathā parivahaścordhvaṃ vāyorvai sapta nemayaḥ /🔽bhūmeryojanalakṣe tu bhānorvai maṇḍalaṃ sthitam // / / //🔽lakṣe divākarasyāpi maṇḍalaṃ śaśinaḥ smṛtam /
analyzed: tathā parivahaḥ ca ūrdhvam vāyoḥ vai sapta nemayaḥ  bhūmeḥ yojana lakṣe tu bhānoḥ vai maṇḍalam sthitam  lakṣe divākarasya api maṇḍalam śaśinaḥ smṛtam
translated: Samvaha, Vivaha, Paravaha, and Parivha above Vayu.🔽The circle of the sun is situated a lakh yojanas above the earth.🔽The circle of the moon is said to be a lakh yojanas above the sun.

original: nakṣatramaṇḍalaṃ kṛtsnaṃ tallakṣeṇa prakāśate // / / //🔽dvelakṣe hyuttare viprā budho nakṣatramaṇḍalāt /
analyzed: nakṣatra maṇḍalam kṛtsnam tat lakṣeṇa prakāśate  dve lakṣe hi uttare viprāḥ budhaḥ nakṣatra maṇḍalāt
translated: The entire circle of the stars shines at a lakh yojanas from that.🔽O Brahmins, Budha (Mercury) is two lakhs above the circle of the stars.

analyzed: tāvat pramāṇa bhāge tu budhasya api uśanāḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Shukra (Venus) is situated at a distance of the same measure from Budha.

analyzed: aṅgārakaḥ pi śukrasya tad pramāṇaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Angaraka (Mars) is also situated at the same measure from Shukra.

analyzed: lakṣa dvayena bhaumasya sthitaḥ devapurohitaḥ
translated: The priest of the gods (Brihaspati) is situated at a distance of two lakhs from Budha.

analyzed: sauriḥ dvi lakṣeṇa guroḥ grahāṇām atha maṇḍalam
translated: The circle of the planets is at a distance of two lakhs from Guru (Jupiter).

analyzed: saptarṣi maṇḍalam tasmāt lakṣa mātre prikāśate
translated: The circle of the seven sages shines at a distance of one lakh from that.

analyzed: ṛṣīṇām maṇḍalāt ūrdhvam lakṣa mātre sthitaḥ dhruvaḥ
translated: Dhruva is situated at a distance of one lakh yojanas above the circle of the sages.

analyzed: meḍhī bhūtaḥ samastasya jyotiścakrasya vai dhruvaḥ
translated: Dhruva is the pivot of the entire circle of luminaries.

original: tatra dharmaḥ sa bhagavān viṣṇurnārāyaṇaḥ sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatra dharmaḥ sa bhagavān viṣṇuḥ nārāyaṇaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: There, the illustrious Vishnu Narayana is stationed, following dharma.

analyzed: nava yojana sāhastraḥ viṣkambhaḥ savituḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The diameter of the sun is said to be nine thousand yojanas.

analyzed: triguṇaḥ tasya vistāraḥ maṇḍalasya pramāṇataḥ
translated: Its circumference is three times that, according to the measure of the circle.

original: dviguṇastasya vistārād vistāraḥ śaśinaḥ smṛtaḥ /🔽tulyastayostu svarbhānurbhūtvādhastāt prasarpati // / / //
analyzed: dviguṇaḥ tasya vistārāt vistāraḥ śaśinaḥ smṛtaḥ  tulyaḥ tayoḥ tu svarbhānuḥ bhūtvā adhastāt prasarpati
translated: The diameter of the moon is said to be twice that.🔽Svaphalka moves below them, assuming the same size.

analyzed: addhṛtya pṛthivī chāyām nirmitaḥ maṇḍala ākṛtiḥ
translated: Having covered the earth's shadow, it is formed in the shape of a circle.

original: svarbhānostu vṛhat sthānaṃ tṛtīyaṃ yat tamomayam // / / //
analyzed: svarbhānoḥ tu vṛhat sthānam tṛtīyam yat tamaḥ mayam
translated: Svaphalka's great abode is the third one, which is full of darkness.

analyzed: candrasya ṣoḍaśaḥ bhāgaḥ bhārgavasya vidhīyate
translated: One-sixteenth of the moon is assigned to Brihaspati.

original: bhārgavāt pādahīnastu vijñeyo vai bṛhaspatiḥ // / / //🔽bṛhaspateḥ pādahīnau vakrasaurāvubhau smṛtau /
analyzed: bhārgavāt pāda hīnaḥ tu vijñeyaḥ vai bṛhaspatiḥ  bṛhaspateḥ pāda hīnau vakra saurau ubhau smṛtau
translated: Brihaspati should be known as one-fourth less than Brihaspati.🔽Varkra and Surya are both said to be one-fourth less than Brihaspati.

analyzed: vistārāt maṇḍalāt ca eva pāda hīnaḥ tayoḥ budhaḥ
translated: Budha is one-fourth less in diameter and circumference than them.

analyzed: tārā nakṣatra rūpāṇi vapuṣmanti iha yāni vai
translated: All the luminous stellar bodies in this world,

analyzed: budhena tāni tulyāni vistārāt maṇḍalāt tathā
translated: Those [stars] are equal to those [planets] in diameter and in the size of their orbs.

analyzed: tārā nakṣatra rūpāṇi hīnāni tu parasparāt
translated: The stars and constellations are inferior to each other.

original: śatāni pañca catvāri trīṇi dve caiva yojane // / / //
analyzed: śatāni pañca catvāri trīṇi dve ca eva yojane
translated: Five hundred, four hundred, three hundred, two hundred [yojanas] in size, respectively.

analyzed: sarva avara nikṛṣṭāni tārakā maṇḍalāni tu
translated: The lowest and most inferior stellar orbs

analyzed: yojanāni ardha mātrāṇi tebhyaḥ hrasvam na vidyate
translated: are only half a yojana in size. There is nothing shorter than that.

analyzed: upariṣṭāt trayaḥ teṣām grahāḥ ye dūra sarpiṇaḥ
translated: Above them are three planets that move far away,

analyzed: sauraḥ ṅgirāḥ ca vakraḥ ca jñeyāḥ manda vicāriṇaḥ
translated: known as Saturn, Jupiter, and Venus, moving slowly.

original: tebhyo 'dhastācca catvāraḥ punaranye mahāgrahāḥ /🔽sūryaḥ saumo budhaścaiva bhārgavaścaiva śīghragāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tebhyaḥ dhastāt ca catvāraḥ punar anye mahāgrahāḥ  sūryaḥ saumaḥ budhaḥ ca eva bhārgavaḥ ca eva śīghragāḥ
translated: Below them are four other great planets,🔽the sun, Mercury, Mars, and Jupiter, moving quickly.

analyzed: dakṣiṇāyana mārga sthaḥ yadā carati raśmimān
translated: When the sun moves along the path of the southern solstice,

analyzed: tadā sarva grahāṇām sa sūryaḥ dhastāt prasarpati
translated: then that sun moves below all the planets.

original: vistīrṇaṃ maṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā tasyordhvaṃ carate śaśī /
analyzed: vistīrṇam maṇḍalam kṛtvā tasya ūrdhvam carate śaśī
translated: Having made a vast orb, the moon moves above it.

analyzed: nakṣatra maṇḍalam kṛtsnam somāt ūrdhvam prasarpati
translated: The entire stellar sphere moves above the moon.

analyzed: nakṣatrebhyaḥ budhaḥ ca ūrdhvam budhāt ūrdhvam tu bhārgavaḥ
translated: Mercury moves above the stars, and Venus moves above Mercury,

analyzed: vakraḥ tu bhārgavāt ūrdhvam vakrāt ūrdhvam bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: The planet Venus is above Mercury, and Jupiter is above Venus.

analyzed: tasmāt śanaiścaraḥ tasmāt saptarṣi maṇḍalam
translated: Beyond that is Saturn, and beyond that is the circle of the seven sages.

analyzed: ṛṣīṇām ca eva vaḥ ca ūrdhvam vyavasthitaḥ
translated: And beyond the seven sages, Dhruva is situated above.

analyzed: yojanānām sahastrāṇi bhāskarasya rathaḥ nava
translated: The chariot of the sun is nine thousand yojanas (in size).

original: īṣādaṇḍastathaiva syād dviguṇo dvijasattamāḥ // / / //🔽sārdhakoṭistathā sapta niyutānyadhikāni tu /
analyzed: īṣā daṇḍaḥ tathā eva syāt dviguṇaḥ dvijasattamāḥ  sārdha koṭiḥ tathā sapta niyutāni adhikāni tu
translated: The axle is of the same length, twice that, O best of Brahmanas.🔽The wheel of the chariot is seven and a half lakhs and twenty thousand yojanas in size.

analyzed: yojanānām tu tasya akṣaḥ tatra cakram pratiṣṭhitam
translated: The wheel is fixed on that axle.

analyzed: tri nābhimati pañca are
translated: It has three naves, five spokes, six rims, and an indestructible nature.

original: saṃvatsarameya kṛtsnaṃ kālacakraṃ pratiṣṭhitam // / / //🔽catkāriṃśat sahastrāṇi dvitīyo 'kṣo vivasvataḥ /🔽pañcānyāni tu sārdhāni syandanasya dvijottamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtsnam kālacakram pratiṣṭhitam  catkāriṃśat sahastrāṇi dvitīyaḥ kṣaḥ vivasvataḥ  pañca anyāni tu sārdhāni syandanasya dvijottamāḥ
translated: The entire wheel of time, measured by the year, is fixed on it.🔽The second axle of the sun's chariot is twenty-five thousand yojanas long, O best of Brahmanas.🔽The other axles are five and a half yojanas long.

analyzed: akṣa pramāṇam ubhayoḥ pramāṇam tat yuga ardhayoḥ
translated: The length of both axles is half a yuga.

analyzed: hrasvaḥ kṣaḥ tad yuga ardhena dhruva ādhāre rathasya tu
translated: The shorter axle is half a yuga long, supporting the chariot on Dhruva.

analyzed: dvitīye kṣe tu tat cakram saṃsthitam mānasa acale
translated: In the second axle, that wheel is situated on the mental mountain.

analyzed: hayāḥ ca sapta chandāṃsi tad nāmāni nibodhata
translated: The seven horses are the meters. Know their names.

original: gāyatrī ca bṛhatyuṣṇik jagatī paṅktireva ca /
analyzed: gāyatrī ca bṛhatī uṣṇih jagatī paṅktiḥ eva ca
translated: The meters are Gayatri, Brihati, Ushnih, Jagati, Pankti,

analyzed: anaṣṭubh triṣṭubh iti uktāḥ chandāṃsi harayaḥ hareḥ
translated: Anustup, and Tristubh. The horses of Hari are said to be these meters.

analyzed: mānasa upari māhendrī prācyām diśi mahā purī
translated: On the mental mountain, in the east, is the great city of Indra.

original: dakṣiṇe na yamasyātha varuṇasya tu paścime // / / //
analyzed: dakṣiṇe na yamasya atha varuṇasya tu paścime
translated: In the south is that of Yama, in the west that of Varuna,

analyzed: uttareṇa tu somasya tad nāmāni nibodhata
translated: And in the north that of Soma. Know their names.

original: amarāvatī saṃyamanī sukhā caiva vibhā kramāt // / / //
translated: They are Amaravati, Samyamanī, Sukhā, Vibhā, in order.

analyzed: kāṣṭhām gataḥ dakṣiṇatas kṣipta iṣuḥ iva sarpati
translated: Going to the south, it moves like an arrow shot.

analyzed: jyotiṣām cakram ādāya devadevaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: Taking the wheel of the luminaries, the god of gods, the lord of creatures,

analyzed: divasasya raviḥ madhye sarvakālam vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The sun is in the middle of the day, always situated.

original: saptadvīpeṣu viprendrā niśāmadhyasya saṃmukham // / / //🔽udayāstamane caiva sarvakālaṃ tu saṃmukhe /
analyzed: sapta dvīpeṣu vipra indrāḥ niśā madhyasya saṃmukham  udaya astamane ca eva sarvakālam tu saṃmukhe
translated: In the seven islands, O best of Brahmins, it is in front at midnight.🔽At sunrise and sunset, it is always in front.

analyzed: aśeṣāsu diśāsu eva tathā eva vidiśāsu ca
translated: In all the directions and in the intermediate directions as well.

analyzed: kulāla cakra paryantaḥ bhraman eṣa yathā īśvaraḥ
translated: As the potter's wheel, when set in motion, continues to revolve, so does the Lord.

analyzed: karoti ahar tathā rātrim vimuñcan medinīm dvijāḥ
translated: He creates day and night, O Brahmins, releasing the earth.

analyzed: divākara karaiḥ etat pūritam bhuvanatrayam
translated: This triple world is filled with the rays of the sun.

analyzed: trailokyam kathitam sadbhiḥ lokānām muni puṅgavāḥ
translated: The three worlds are described by the virtuous as the worlds, O foremost of sages.

analyzed: āditya mūlam akhilam tri lokam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: The entire triple world has the sun as its root, there is no doubt about this.

analyzed: bhavati asmāt jagat kṛtsnam sa deva asura mānuṣam
translated: From it originates the entire universe with gods, demons and men.

original: rudrendropendracandrāṇāṃ viprendrāṇāṃ divaukasām /🔽dyutirdyutimatāṃ kṛtsnaṃ yattejaḥ sārvalaukikam // / / //
analyzed: rudra indra upendra candrāṇām vipra indrāṇām divaukasām  dyutiḥ dyutimatām kṛtsnam yat tejaḥ sārvalaukikam
translated: Of Rudra, Indra, Upendra, the moon, the foremost of Brahmins, the dwellers of heaven,🔽the entire splendor of the radiant ones, the brilliance that is universal.
The soul of all, the lord of all worlds, the great god, the lord of creatures,

analyzed: sūryaḥ eva trilokasya mūlam parama daivatam
translated: the sun alone is the root of the three worlds, the supreme deity.

analyzed: dvādaśa anye tathā ādityāḥ devāḥ te ye dhikāriṇaḥ
translated: The twelve other Adityas, the gods who are in authority,

original: nirvahanti padaṃ tasya tadaṃśā viṣṇumūrtayaḥ // / / //🔽sarve namasyanti sahastrabhānuṃ
analyzed: nirvahanti padam tasya tad aṃśāḥ viṣṇu mūrtayaḥ  sarve namasyanti sahastra bhānum
translated: are the parts of him, the forms of Vishnu, who carry out his position.🔽All the beings, from the Gandharvas, gods, serpents, birds, men and others,

analyzed: gandharva deva uraga kinvannara ādyāḥ
translated: bow to the thousand-rayed one.

analyzed: yajanti yajñaiḥ vividhaiḥ dvijendrā
translated: The foremost of Brahmins worship him with various sacrifices.

original: śchandomayaṃ brahmamayaṃ purāṇam // / / //🔽iti śrīkūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryāṃ saṃhitāryā pūrvavibhāge ekonacatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ🔽sūta uvāca🔽sa ratho 'dhiṣṭhito devairādityairvasubhistathā /
analyzed: śchandaḥ mayam brahma mayam purāṇam  iti śrī kūrmapurāṇe ṣaṭsāhastryām saṃhitā āryā pūrva vibhāge ekonacatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ  sūtaḥ uvāca  sa rathaḥ dhiṣṭhitaḥ devaiḥ ādityaiḥ vasubhiḥ tathā
translated: It is the essence of the Vedas, the essence of Brahman, and the ancient one.

analyzed: bālakhilyāḥ nayantyaḥ tam parivārya udayāt ravim

translated: Thus, by the power of the sun, all the stars and constellations

translated: With herbs, he sustains men here, and with Svadha, he sustains the ancestors.🔽With Amrita, he satisfies all the gods with the three.

analyzed: śaradi api ca varṣāsu caturbhaiḥ saṃpravarṣati

analyzed: hemante śiśire ca eva himam utsṛjati tribhiḥ

translated: and Ansha is in the month of Chaitra. Dhatri is in the month of Vaishakha.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhāmūle bhavet indraḥ āṣāḍhe savitā raviḥ
translated: In Jyeshtha and Mulas, Indra is the Sun. In Ashadha, Savita is the Sun.

original: vivasvān śrāvaṇe māsi prauṣṭhapadyāṃ bhagaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vivasvān śrāvaṇe māsi prauṣṭhapadyām bhagaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: In the month of Shravana, Vivasvan, and in the month of Bhadrapada, Bhaga is remembered.

analyzed: parjanyaḥ śvayuji tvaṣṭā kārtike māsi bhāskaraḥ
translated: In Ashvayuj, Parjanya, and in the month of Kartika, the Sun is Tvashtri.

analyzed: mārgaśīrṣa bhavet mitraḥ pauṣe viṣṇuḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: In Margashirsha, Mitra, and in Pausha, the eternal Vishnu.

analyzed: pañca raśmi sahastrāṇi varuṇasya arka karmaṇi
translated: Varuna has five thousand rays in his solar work.

original: ṣaḍbhiḥ sahastraiḥ pūṣā tu devoṃśaḥ saptabhistathā // / / //
analyzed: ṣaḍbhiḥ sahastraiḥ pūṣā tu deva oṃśaḥ saptabhiḥ tathā
translated: Pusha, the god Amsha, has six thousand, and so does Savita.

analyzed: dhātā aṣṭabhiḥ sahastraiḥ tu navabhiḥ tu śatakratuḥ
translated: Dhatri has eight thousand, and Shatakratu has nine thousand.

analyzed: vivasvān daśabhiḥ pāti pāti ekādaśabhiḥ bhagaḥ
translated: Vivasvan protects with ten thousand, and Bhaga with eleven thousand.

analyzed: saptabhiḥ tapate mitraḥ tvaṣṭā ca eva aṣṭabhiḥ tapet
translated: Mitra shines with seven thousand, and Tvashtri shines with eight thousand.

analyzed: aryamā daśabhaiḥ pāti parjanyaḥ navabhiḥ tapet
translated: Aryaman protects with ten thousand, and Parjanya shines with nine thousand.

original: ṣaḍbhī raśmisahastraistu viṣṇustapati viśvasṛk // / / //🔽vasante kapilaḥ sūryo grīṣme kāñcanasaprabhaḥ /🔽śveto varṣāsu varṇena pāṇḍuraḥ śaradi prabhuḥ /
analyzed: ṣaḍbhiḥ raśmi sahastraiḥ tu viṣṇuḥ tapati viśvasṛj  vasante kapilaḥ sūryaḥ grīṣme kāñcana saprabhaḥ  śvetaḥ varṣāsu varṇena pāṇḍuraḥ śaradi prabhuḥ
translated: Vishnu, the creator of the universe, shines with six thousand rays.🔽In spring, the Sun is tawny-colored. In summer, it is golden-hued.🔽In the rainy season, it is white in color. In autumn, the Lord is pale.

analyzed: hemante tāmra varṇaḥ syāt śiśire lohitaḥ raviḥ
translated: In winter, it is copper-colored. In the cold season, the Sun is red.

analyzed: oṣadhīṣu balam dhatte svadhām api pitṛṣu atha
translated: The Sun gives strength to the herbs, and to the Fathers their food.

analyzed: sūryaḥ mara tvam amṛte trayam triṣu niyacchati
translated: The Sun gives immortality to the nectar, and the three to the three.

original: anye cāṣṭau grahā jñeyāḥ sūryeṇādhiṣṭhitā dvijāḥ /
analyzed: anye ca aṣṭau grahāḥ jñeyāḥ sūryeṇa adhiṣṭhitāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: And the other eight planets should be known, O Brahmins, presided over by the Sun.

analyzed: candramāḥ soma putraḥ ca śukraḥ ca eva bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: The Moon, the son of Soma, Shukra, Brihaspati,

analyzed: bhaumaḥ mandaḥ tathā rāhuḥ ketumān api ca aṣṭamaḥ
translated: Mars, Saturn, Rahu, and Ketu as the eighth.

original: sarve dhruve nibaddhā vai grahāste vātaraśmibhiḥ /🔽bhrāmyamāṇā yathāyogaṃ bhramantyanudivākaram // / / //
analyzed: sarve dhruve nibaddhāḥ vai grahāḥ te vāta raśmibhiḥ  bhrāmyamāṇāḥ yathāyogam bhramanti anu divākaram
translated: All those planets are bound to the pole star by the wind-rays.🔽Revolving as they should, they revolve following the sun.

analyzed: alāta cakra vat yānti vāta cakra īritāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: The Brahmins, impelled by the wind-wheel, move like a whirling firebrand.

original: yasmād vahati tān vāyuḥ pravahastena sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasmāt vahati tān vāyuḥ pravahaḥ tena sa smṛtaḥ
translated: Since the wind carries them, it is known as Pravaha.

analyzed: rathaḥ tri cakraḥ somasya kunda ābhāḥ tasya vājinaḥ
translated: The chariot of Soma has three wheels, and its horses are like jasmine flowers.

original: vāmadakṣiṇato yuktā daśa tena niśākaraḥ // / / //🔽vīthyāśrayāṇi carati nakṣatrāṇi raviryathā /
analyzed: vāma dakṣiṇataḥ yuktāḥ daśa tena niśākaraḥ  vīthi āśrayāṇi carati nakṣatrāṇi raviḥ yathā
translated: They are yoked to the left and right, ten in number, by which the moon moves.

analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ viprāḥ kṣatriyāḥ śuṣmiṇaḥ tathā

analyzed: krauñcaḥ vāmanakaḥ ca eva tṛtīyaḥ ca andhakārakaḥ

analyzed: arcayanti mahādevam yajña dāna samādhibhiḥ

analyzed: udayaḥ raivataḥ ca eva śyāmākaḥ stagiriḥ tathā

analyzed: āmbikeyaḥ tathā ramyaḥ keśarī ca iti parvatāḥ

analyzed: magāḥ ca magadhāḥ ca eva mānavāḥ mandagāḥ tathā

analyzed: vrata upavāsaiḥ vividhaiḥ devadevam divākaram

analyzed: tatra puṇyāḥ janapadāḥ nānā āścarya samanvitāḥ

analyzed: śvetāḥ tatra narāḥ nityam jāyante viṣṇu tatparāḥ

analyzed: na ādhayaḥ vyādhayaḥ tatra jarā mṛtyu bhayam na ca

analyzed: krodha lobha vinirmuktāḥ māyā mātsarya varjitāḥ

analyzed: nārāyaṇa parāḥ sarve nārāyaṇa parāyaṇāḥ

analyzed: kecid japanti tapyanti kecid pare

analyzed: anye brahma bhāvena bhāvitāḥ

analyzed: tatra nārāyaṇasya anyat durgamam duratikramam

analyzed: nārāyaṇam nāma puram vyāsa ādyaiḥ upaśobhitam

analyzed: nānā vilāsa saṃpannaiḥ kāmukaiḥ ati komalaiḥ

analyzed: śrīmat pavitram devasya śrīpateḥ amita ojasaḥ

analyzed: vicintyamānaḥ yogi indraiḥ sanandana purogamaiḥ

Ananta, clad in blue garments, of great illusion, with mighty arms,

analyzed: samāste tad manāḥ nityam pītvā nārāyaṇa amṛtam

analyzed: etāvat śakyate vaktum nārāyaṇa puram hi tat

analyzed: nārāyaṇāt idam jātam tasmin eva vyavasthitam

analyzed: kṣīrārṇavam samāśritya dvīpaḥ puṣkara saṃvṛtaḥ

analyzed: ekaḥ eva atra vipra indrāḥ parvataḥ mānasa uttaraḥ

analyzed: yojanānām sahastrāṇi sārdham pañcāśat ucchritaḥ

analyzed: aparau mānasasya atha parvatasya anu maṇḍalau

analyzed: mahāvītam smṛtam varṣam dhātakīkhaṇḍam eva ca

analyzed: svādu udakena udadhinā puṣkaraḥ parivāritaḥ

analyzed: tasmin dvīpe mahā vṛkṣaḥ nyagrodhaḥ mara pūjitaḥ

analyzed: tasmin nivasati brahmā viśvātmā viśvabhāvanaḥ

analyzed: tatra eva muni śārdūlāḥ śiva nārāyaṇa ālayaḥ

analyzed: vasati atra mahādevaḥ hara ūrddha hariḥ avyayaḥ

analyzed: saṃpūjyamānaḥ brahma ādyaiḥ kumāra ādyaiḥ ca yogibhiḥ

analyzed: gandharvaiḥ kinnaraiḥ yakṣaiḥ īśvaraḥ kṛṣṇa piṅgalaḥ

analyzed: svasthāḥ tatra prajāḥ sarvāḥ brahmaṇā sadṛśa tviṣaḥ

analyzed: nirāmayāḥ viśokāḥ ca rāga dveṣa vivarjitāḥ

analyzed: satya anṛte na tatra āstām na uttama adhama madhyamāḥ

analyzed: pareṇa puṣkarasya atha sthitaḥ mahān
translated: Beyond Pushkara, there is a great ocean.

analyzed: svādu udaka samudraḥ tu samantāt dvijasattamāḥ

analyzed: pareṇa tasya mahatī dṛśyate loka saṃsthitiḥ

analyzed: kāñcanī dviguṇā bhūmiḥ sarvā ca eva śilā upamā

analyzed: tasyāḥ pareṇa śailaḥ tu maryādā ātmā ātma maṇḍalaḥ
translated: Beyond that is the mountain Marichatmamandala,

analyzed: prakāśaḥ ca aprakāśaḥ ca lokālokaḥ saḥ ucyate

analyzed: yojanānām sahastrāṇi daśa tasya ucchrayaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: It is said to be ten thousand yojanas high,

analyzed: tāvān eva ca vistāraḥ lokālokaḥ mahā giriḥ

analyzed: tamaḥ ca aṇḍa kaṭāhena samantāt pariveṣṭitam

analyzed: etaiḥ sapta mahā lokāḥ pātālāḥ sapta kīrtitāḥ

analyzed: brahmāṇḍasya eṣa vistāraḥ saṃkṣepeṇa mayā uditaḥ

analyzed: aṇḍānām īdṛśānām tu koṭyaḥ jñeyāḥ sahastraśas
